channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘I’ve been kept in poverty’: Do I take a $70K job at 74 and lose my Section 8 housing allowance?
item.description: “After the age of 50, I really only had sporadic contract work and I had to sell my house.”

item.title: I’m single, 75, and living with kidney disease and a pacemaker. I’ve no long-term care insurance. Will I be OK?
item.description: “My income is $120,000 per year which includes $60,000 in Social Security and a pension.”

item.title: Don’t sleep on Cohere: Command A Reasoning, its first reasoning model, is built for enterprise customer service and more

item.title: Off-price retailer Ross flashes another sign that consumers are seeking discounts this fall
item.description: Ross Stores joins TJ Maxx parent in seeing consumers flock to their discounted merchandise.

item.title: Here’s the $863 billion secret Powell, Trump and Bessent aren’t telling us about gold and bitcoin
item.description: The inevitable gold-price reckoning that could fund Trump’s bitcoin ambitions — and sting your bank account.

item.title: The good news is we got an $800K windfall. The bad news is it came after a layoff. What do we do with it?
item.description: This couple, still in their 50s, are thinking about a vacation home and investing.

item.title: Inside Walmart’s AI security stack: How a startup mentality is hardening enterprise-scale defense
item.description: Walmart CISO Jerry Geisler on securing agentic AI, modernizing identity, and Zero Trust for enterprise-scale cybersecurity resilience.
